medical_history.chief_complaint: A 12-year-old boy with symptoms of polydipsia, polyuria, weight loss, headache, vomiting, ataxia, complex partial seizures, and encephalopathy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 6 months prior, initially presenting as polydipsia and polyuria, progressing to 40-pound weight loss over weeks, followed by intractable headache, vomiting, ataxia, and seizures.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Numerous (40 to 50) benign congenital nevi ranging in diameter from 1 to 10 cm; no previous diagnosis of neurocutaneous melanosis or CNS disease.
medical_history.family_history: The patient had a family history of rheumatoid arthritis.
